intro: Porana delavayi, commonly known as the Delavay's porana, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
